title: What is Miriam Margolyes famous for and what new shows is she in?
text:
Miriam Margolyes has been a regular on stage and screen for over five decades (Picture: Dave Benett/Getty Images)

Miriam Margolyes has had a colourful career on stage and screen, spanning over 50 years – and she’s not stopping yet.

The award-winning acting veteran, who is now 78 years old, is set to make an appearance on This Morning today and if it’s anything like her previous encounters with Philip Schofield and Holly Willoughby, we’re set for a cracking show today.

But how is Miriam so well known and after her turn in Call the Midwife as Mother Mildred recently, what can we expect to see her in next?

What is Miriam Margolyes famous for?

Miriam Margolyes got her first roles on TV in the 1960s, appearing in a show called Theatre 625 in 1965 and then Boy Meets Girl in 1968.

She had found fame by the 1980s, when she appeared in iconic TV Series Blackadder as Infanta Maria Escalosa of Spain in 1983 and the actress returned in 1986 to play Lady Whiteadder in Blackadder II.

Margolyes has starred in a number of well-known movies, including Little Shop of Horrors in 1986 where she played the Dental Nurse, Little Dorrit in which she played Flora Finching in 1987 and Baz Luhrmann’s Rome + Juliet, starring Leonardo DiCaprio in 1996, where Margolyes played Juliet’s nurse.

The actress also starred in The Age of Innocence in 1993 as Mrs. Mingott, a performance which won her a BAFTA for Best Supporting Actress that same year.

Lending her voice to various famous films, Margolyes is the voice of the matchmaker in Disney’s classic film Mulan and also the voice of the Fly in Babe among others.

Miriam Margoyles first appeared in Harry Potter in the very first Chamber of Secrets movie (Picture: Dave Benett/Getty Images)

In more recent years, Margolyes is most famous for appearing as Professor Sprout in the Harry Potter films and becoming the newest addition to the Call the Midwife cast in which she stars alongside actresses such as Helen George.

Following her recent documentaries, The Real Marigold on Tour and Miram’s Dead Good Adventure which aired earlier this year, Miriam will next appear in an Australia film called Miss Fisher & the Crypt of Tears which is meant to be released in 2020.
